item.title: [Python] [Raspberry Pi] Stepping motor control with Raspberry Pi
item.description: #Introduction I bought a Razz pie, thinking that I might find a new hobby indoors during lockdown. I wondered if it would be useful for experiments later if I could control the motor, so I bought a stepper motor together, so I will control it. It is interesting just to rotate it at a constant speed, but the goal was to be able to do arbitrary movements. I started from almost zero knowledge of electric and electronic circuits, but it was easy to do because various information was dropped on the net.

item.title: [Python] With VS Code's SSH connection function, edit and debug the code in Raspberry Pi
item.description: What is #VSCode? Abbreviation for source code editor “Visual Studio Code” developed by Microsoft. As a free, lightweight, and multifunctional editor, it is rapidly gaining popularity. From 2019/10 edition, SSH connection function to RaspberryPi (ARM v8) is officially supported, so I wrote the result of trying remote editing of Python code in Raspberry Pi. ** In conclusion, we were able to achieve debugging with breakpoints and a comfortable remote development environment!

item.title: [Python] Making an autonomous driving robot car with Raspberry Pi3 B+ and ultrasonic distance sensor HC-SR04
item.description: #Introduction The elements that make up a self-driving car in the real world are vehicle position estimation, object recognition, action judgment, and vehicle body control. It is possible to implement all four of these elements on the basis of radio control, but it is not easy to easily estimate the vehicle’s position, and this time the target is low-speed driving, so there is almost no need for body control. Therefore, this time, I would like to use an ultrasonic distance sensor to recognize an object in front of me and make a simple action decision to avoid it with a radio-controlled robot car that operates automatically.

item.title: [Python] Machine learning with Raspberry Pi 4 and Coral USB Accelerator
item.description: #Introduction This article summarizes the installation procedure of Raspberry Pi 4 and Coral USB Accelerator as a method of machine learning with edge device. Raspberry Pi 4 is the latest generation of the current model. The CPU and memory performance have been greatly improved, and USB 3.0 is also supported. Coral USB Accelerator is Google’s dedicated ASIC developed by Google for machine learning on edge devices. This dedicated ASIC is called Edge TPU, and you can use TensorFlow Lite’s flake work specialized for inference at the edge.

item.title: [Python] Simulate temperature measurement with Raspberry Pi + Flask + SQLite + Ajax
item.description: #Introduction It is convenient to be able to debug with software alone when measuring temperature with Raspberry Pi and acquiring sensor status with GPIO. Therefore, we created a debug environment that simulates temperature measurement and acquisition of sensor status with GPIO, and displays it on a website (created with Flask). Save the simulated temperature and sensor state in SQLite and refresh the page via Ajax. The temperature and sensor values are hard to understand, so it looks as if the living room temperature and sensor had changed.

item.title: [Python] Handling GPS with Raspberry Pi 3 Python
item.description: This is a memo of GPS module in Raspberry Pi 3 Python. The OS version of Raspberry Pi 3 is Raspbian GNU/Linux 8.0 (jessie) Raspbian GNU/Linux 9.4 (stretch) (Corrected on October 5, 2018) is. GPS module For the GPS module, I used Akizuki Denshi’s “[GPS receiver kit 1PPS output with “Michibiki” compatible]” (http://akizukidenshi.com/catalog/g/gK-09991/)". This GPS module sends out the received GPS data serially. There are two methods for serial communication with Raspberry Pi3: using a USB port and using a GPIO pin.
